name: hammerlock
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
especially in wrestling, a way of holding an opponent's arm bent behind their back so that they cannot move it: in a hammerlock He was up on his toes with his left arm cranked behind his back in a hammerlock.
a situation of complete control over someone or something: hammerlock on If any one company gets a hammerlock on the online advertising space, that is worrying.
More examplesFewer examplesShe transitions to a hammerlock and Rainer goes to the ropes to break the hold.Once more Bridget locked her left arm into a hammerlock. He was more or less put in a hammerlock by his manager and told to go out and talk to customers.Neither right nor left has a hammerlock on the American electorate.
